data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 10:08
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
SENIOR COUNSELOR TO THE VICE CHAIR
And this is a deposition of
General Michael Flynn, conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate the
January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to House Resolution 503.
At this time, I'd like to ask the witness to please state your full name and spell
your last name for the record.
And, Counsel, could you please introduce yourself and the others who are joining
David Warrington, counsel for General Flynn.
C-o-1-u-m-b-o; Gary Lawkowski, L-a-w-k-o-w-s-k-i; and our legal assistant, Erin Potter,
At this time, I'm going to ask that the official reporter swear you in,
With me by video are my colleagues Michael Columbo,
Can you please stand and raise your right hand?
Do you solemnly declare and affirm, under the penalty of perjury,
that the testimony you are about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing
So this will be a staff-led deposition.
And if any members decide to join or ask
questions, they may do so and will probably do so by turning on their camera, and I'll
defer to them at that time.
I am a senior investigative counsel for the select
Also in the room today from the committee are
professional staff member for the committee.
She's investigative counsel to the committee.

question to preserve a privilege recognized by the select committee.

chairman overrules such an objection, then you will be required to answer the question.
